classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, Lower-Division E, F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division C should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: Upper-Division B, C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, or E.

Any ICS course can go here.

When creating an individual program, it should consist of 28 units, with at least 16 units at the 300-400 level. Courses are selected by the student in consultation with an advising faculty member. The student must also provide a written justification for the courses and the way they constitute a cohesive, integrated course of study. The list of courses is a contract between the student and the Department.
